verses.roman:
"āre mūrkha, āpanāra kaili sarva-nāśa!
dui ta' īśvare tora nāhika viśvāsa

synonyms: āre mūrkha—O fool; āpanāra—of yourself; kaili—you have done; sarva-nāśa—loss of all auspiciousness; dui ta' īśvare—in the two controllers; tora—your; nāhika viśvāsa—there is no faith.
translation: "You are a fool," he said."You have brought ill fortune upon yourself, for you have no knowledge of the existence of the two Lords, Jagannāthadeva and Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, nor have you faith in Them.
